report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0225 Use after free in WebGPU
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in WebGPU, identified as CVE-2024-0225. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page. The latest stable version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the fix is 120.0.2210.121, based on Chromium version 120.0.6099.199/200, released on 1/5/2024.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0224 Use after free in WebAudio
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in WebAudio, identified as CVE-2024-0224. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.121 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.121. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0223 Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a heap buffer overflow vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-0223. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is in the ANGLE component of Chromium, which is ingested by Microsoft Edge. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.121 is no longer vulnerable to this issue. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the ANGLE component of Chromium, and an attacker could exploit it to execute arbitrary code. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.121. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to this latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.
section_1_data.symptoms: The symptom of this vulnerability is a heap buffer overflow in ANGLE, a component of Chromium.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is to update to the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) which is no longer vulnerable. The version is 120.0.2210.121.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0222 Use after free in ANGLE
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in ANGLE, identified as CVE-2024-0222. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.121 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.121. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows for a use after free condition in ANGLE, a component of Chromium, which can be exploited by an attacker.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is to update to the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) which is no longer vulnerable.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21320 Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21320, affects various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10/11. The vulnerability allows an attacker to convince a user to load a malicious file onto a vulnerable system, leading to spoofing. The attack vector is through user interaction, requiring the user to manipulate a specially crafted file. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for the affected Windows versions, including Monthly Rollup and Security Update patches. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates that an official fix is available. Mitigations include applying group policies to block NTLM hash and disabling NTLM. System administrators are advised to apply the available security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and specific patch details, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21316 Windows Server Key Distribution Service Security Feature Bypass
section_1_data.summary: Windows Server Key Distribution Service is affected by a Security Feature Bypass vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21316, with a CVSS base score of 6.1 and a temporal score of 5.3. The vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker with admin privileges creating an x509 certificate with an MD5 property, causing certificate validation to fail with no further checks. This could lead to a total loss of confidentiality and integrity, allowing the attacker to divulge all resources within the impacted component and modify protected files. Microsoft has provided a security update for various affected products, including Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022, with build numbers 10.0.14393.6614, 10.0.22631.3007, 10.0.25398.643, and others. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attacker requires no user interaction, and the vulnerability is remotely exploitable, making it crucial for organizations to prioritize the deployment of the official fix.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21314 Microsoft Message Queuing Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by an Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21314, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to read small portions of heap memory, potentially leading to the disclosure of sensitive information. The attack vector is through the network with low complexity and no user interaction required. The impact is limited to confidentiality, with no impact on integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For further details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21313 Windows TCP/IP Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows TCP/IP Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2024-21313) has been identified with a base score of 5.3 and a temporal score of 4.6. The vulnerability allows unauthorized access to unencrypted contents of IPsec packets from other sessions on a server. It is remotely exploitable, requires no privileges, and user interaction is necessary for exploitation. The attack complexity is high, involving a machine-in-the-middle (MITM) attack. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and multiple editions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21311 Windows Cryptographic Services Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cryptographic Services in various Windows versions are affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21311. The vulnerability has a base score of 5.5 and a temporal score of 4.8, indicating a moderate severity. It is caused by a locally authenticated attacker sending a specially crafted request to the cryptography provider's vulnerable function, potentially leading to the disclosure of small portions of heap memory. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for affected Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and various editions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21310 Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21310, with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges. The attack complexity is low, and no user interaction is required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server editions, with build numbers ranging from 10.0.17763.5329 to 10.0.25398.643. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21309 Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2024-21309) has been identified with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, posing a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. Microsoft has released security updates for various affected products, including Windows Server 2022, Windows 11 versions 21H2, 22H2, and 23H2, addressing the elevation of privilege issue. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating the availability of complete vendor solutions. System administrators are advised to promptly apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect the affected systems from potential privilege escalation attacks.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to run arbitrary code in kernel mode, which could allow the attacker to install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update as soon as possible.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21307 Remote Desktop Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The CVE-2024-21307 vulnerability affects the Remote Desktop Client, allowing remote code execution. The vulnerability has a base score of 7.5 and a temporal score of 6.5, indicating high severity. It is remotely exploitable, requiring no user privileges, but user interaction is necessary for successful exploitation. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server, addressing the vulnerability. System administrators are advised to ensure that the Remote Desktop client for Windows Desktop is at version 1.2.5105.0 or higher to mitigate the risk. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and an official fix is available, indicating the urgency of applying the security updates. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21306 Microsoft Bluetooth Driver Spoofing Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Bluetooth Driver is affected by a spoofing vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21306, with a CVSS score of 5.7/5.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker within proximity to the target system to send and receive radio transmissions, requiring the victim to pair with the attacker's Bluetooth device. Successful exploitation could lead to a total loss of integrity, impacting confidentiality and availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, with security updates released for various Windows versions, including Windows 10 and 11, and Windows Server 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows an attacker to spoof the Microsoft Bluetooth Driver, leading to a total loss of integrity. The attack requires user interaction and can be launched from a logically adjacent network.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their Microsoft Bluetooth Driver to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21305 Hypervisor-Protected Code Integrity (HVCI) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Hypervisor-Protected Code Integrity (HVCI) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21305, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability affects specific Microsoft Surface hardware computers, including Hub 3, Laptop Studio, Pro 7+, and others. It is caused by Windows incorrectly allowing certain kernel-mode pages to be marked as Read, Write, Execute (RWX) even with HVCI enabled, enabling an attacker to run a specially crafted application at administrator level to bypass code integrity protections. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10 and 11, to address this vulnerability. The exploit requires an attacker to compromise admin credentials on the device, and successful exploitation could lead to a total loss of integrity or a complete loss of protection. System administrators are advised to apply the available security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20700 Windows Hyper-V Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is impacted by a critical remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20700, with a CVSS base score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code without requiring user interaction or privileges. Successful exploitation can lead to high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected systems. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to win a race condition, and the attack vector is adjacent, necessitating access to the restricted network before running an attack. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server, addressing the vulnerability with build numbers 10.0.25398.643, 10.0.22631.3007, 10.0.19045.3930, and others. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of remote code execution. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: A vulnerability in Windows Hyper-V could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely. This could be triggered if a user opens a specially crafted document or visits a malicious webpage that contains embedded TrueType fonts.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update that addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Windows Hyper-V handles TrueType fonts. Users are advised to apply the update immediately.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20699 Windows Hyper-V Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20699, with a CVSS score of 5.5/4.8. The vulnerability allows an authenticated attacker to run a specially crafted application on a vulnerable Hyper-V guest, potentially interacting with processes of another guest on the same host. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and privileges required, and no user interaction. The impact is a total loss of availability. Microsoft has released security updates for various affected versions, including Windows Server 2022, 23H2 Edition, Windows 11, and Windows 10. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to determine the support lifecycle for the software, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability, resulting in the attacker being able to fully deny access to resources in the impacted component.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their Windows Hyper-V to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20698 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2024-20698) has been identified with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, impacting various Windows versions including Windows Server 2022, Windows 11, and Windows 10. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. An official fix is available in the form of security updates for the affected Windows versions, including build numbers 10.0.25398.643, 10.0.22631.3007, 10.0.19045.3930, 10.0.22621.3007, 10.0.19044.3930, 10.0.22000.2713, 10.0.20348.2227, 10.0.17763.5329. System administrators are advised to prioritize the installation of these security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Microsoft has acknowledged the security community's efforts in coordinated vulnerability disclosure.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20697 Windows Libarchive Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Libarchive is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20697, with a CVSS score of 7.3/6.4. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the target system, requiring low privileges and user interaction. This vulnerability impacts Windows Server 2022, Windows 11 Version 23H2, and Windows 11 Version 22H2 for both x64-based and ARM64-based systems. Microsoft has provided a security update with build numbers 10.0.25398.643, 10.0.22631.3007, and 10.0.22621.3007 for the affected systems. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attack vector is local, despite the CVE title indicating remote code execution, as the attacker or victim needs to execute code from the local machine to exploit the vulnerability. Microsoft acknowledges the coordinated vulnerability disclosure efforts and provides detailed information in the Microsoft Knowledge Base for further reference.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can execute arbitrary code on the target system by exploiting the vulnerability in Windows Libarchive.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has not yet provided a fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to monitor the official Microsoft Security Response Center for updates and apply the fix as soon as it becomes available.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20696 Windows Libarchive Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Libarchive is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20696, with a CVSS score of 7.3/6.4. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the target system remotely, requiring low privileges and user interaction. This vulnerability impacts various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2019/2022. Microsoft has provided a security update for affected Windows versions, addressing the vulnerability and preventing remote code execution. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that no exploit code is available, and the remediation level is 'Official Fix,' signifying the availability of a complete vendor solution. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Update Guide at https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20696.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20694 Windows CoreMessaging Information Disclosure  Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows CoreMessaging is affected by an Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20694, with a CVSS base score of 5.5/10. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read small portions of stack memory, leading to information disclosure. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. The impact is limited to confidentiality, with no impact on integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution in the form of security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server 2016, 2019, and 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20692 Microsoft Local Security Authority Subsystem Service Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Local Security Authority Subsystem Service is affected by an Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20692, with a CVSS score of 5.7/5.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker to retrieve sensitive data in plain-text by convincing a user to connect to an Active Directory Domain Controller and stealing network secrets. This could lead to further attacks. The attack requires user interaction and low privileges, meaning an authorized attacker must be on the network to monitor domain network traffic or convince an authenticated user to execute a malicious script. Microsoft has provided security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Support Lifecycle.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20691 Windows Themes Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Themes Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2024-20691) has been identified with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows the disclosure of initialized or uninitialized memory in the process heap, potentially leading to information disclosure. The attack complexity is high, requiring an attacker to win a race condition, and it does not require user interaction. The vulnerability affects various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. Microsoft has provided a security update for all affected platforms, addressing the vulnerability and preventing potential information disclosure. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20690 Windows Nearby Sharing Spoofing Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Nearby Sharing in Windows 10 and 11 is affected by a spoofing vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20690, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability allows a malicious actor to spoof a machine with the same name that a user is searching for, requiring user interaction for exploitation. This could lead to a total loss of integrity, enabling the attacker to modify protected files. Microsoft has provided security updates for affected Windows versions, including 21H2, 22H2, 23H2, and 1809, with build numbers 10.0.22000.2713, 10.0.19045.3930, 10.0.22631.3007, and 10.0.17763.5329. System administrators are advised to apply these security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No workaround or temporary fix is provided, emphasizing the importance of prompt patching to address this vulnerability.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows an attacker to spoof the identity of a legitimate user in Windows Nearby Sharing, leading to unauthorized access and potential data manipulation.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their Windows Nearby Sharing to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20687 Microsoft AllJoyn API Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft AllJoyn API is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20687, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability without any user interaction. It impacts various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server editions. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates with build numbers 10.0.14393.6614, 10.0.10240.20402, 10.0.25398.643, 10.0.22631.3007, 10.0.19045.3930, 10.0.22621.3007, 10.0.19044.3930, 10.0.22000.2713, 10.0.20348.2227, 10.0.17763.5329. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20683 Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20683, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability affects various Windows Server and Windows client versions. It is caused by a flaw in the Win32k component, allowing an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Successful exploitation could lead to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution in the form of security updates for the affected platforms, including Windows Server 2008, 2012, 2016, and various versions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the official patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the security of their systems. For further details and to download the necessary security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20682 Windows Cryptographic Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cryptographic Services is affected by a Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20682, with a CVSS score of 7.8/6.8. The vulnerability allows an authenticated attacker to trigger it without requiring admin or elevated privileges. Although the attack vector is local, it results in remote code execution, meaning an attacker or victim needs to execute code from the local machine to exploit the vulnerability. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, addressing the Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security update, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20681 Windows Subsystem for Linux Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20681, with a CVSS score of 7.8/6.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided security updates for various affected Windows versions, including Windows 10 and 11, as well as Windows Server 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix. No specific workaround or mitigation beyond applying the provided security updates is mentioned. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: Unsafe default configurations for LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing exist on Active Directory domain controllers that let LDAP clients communicate with them without enforcing LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing. This can open Active Directory domain controllers to an elevation of privilege vulnerability.
section_1_data.fixes: At the time of the security update, no official fix has been released. Users are advised to monitor Microsoft's official channels for updates regarding this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20680 Windows Message Queuing Client (MSMQC) Information Disclosure
section_1_data.summary: Windows Message Queuing Client (MSMQC) is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20680, with a CVSS score of 6.5/5.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read small portions of heap memory. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The exploit is remotely exploitable, impacting the confidentiality of the information resources managed by the software component. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20674 Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20674, has been classified as Critical. The vulnerability allows impersonation by bypassing the authentication feature, potentially leading to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by establishing a machine-in-the-middle (MITM) attack or local network spoofing, then sending a malicious Kerberos message to spoof itself as the Kerberos authentication server. The attack vector is adjacent, requiring the attacker to gain access to the restricted network before running an attack. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, with security updates released for various Windows versions including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2008, and Windows 10, addressing the Security Feature Bypass vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of their systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20674 Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2024-20674) has been updated with FAQ information. This vulnerability has a critical impact, with a CVSS score of 9.0. It allows impersonation and could be exploited by an authenticated attacker through a machine-in-the-middle (MITM) attack or local network spoofing. The attack vector is adjacent, requiring the attacker to gain access to the restricted network before running an attack. Successful exploitation could lead to a scope change, affecting resources beyond the security scope managed by the vulnerable component. Microsoft has provided security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, addressing this critical vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20666 BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20666, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. This vulnerability allows an attacker with physical access to bypass the BitLocker Device Encryption feature on the system storage device, potentially gaining access to encrypted data. The attack vector is physical, with low attack complexity and low privileges required. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022, to address this vulnerability. Depending on the Windows version, system administrators may need to take additional steps to update Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) to be protected from this vulnerability. For some versions, the process of updating WinRE is fully automated, while for others, an automated solution is available. Microsoft has also developed a sample script to automate updating WinRE from the running Windows OS. It's important to note that a vulnerable version of WinRE WIM file cannot be used to exploit this vulnerability, and if TPM+PIN BitLocker protectors are being used, the attacker needs to know the TPM PIN to exploit the vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates and follow the recommended steps to ensure protection from this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20664 Microsoft Message Queuing Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by an Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20664, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read small portions of heap memory without any user interaction. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, making it exploitable remotely without any interaction from any user. The impact includes high confidentiality loss but no impact on integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server editions. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20663 Windows Message Queuing Client (MSMQC) Information Disclosure
section_1_data.summary: Windows Message Queuing Client (MSMQC) is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20663, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to read small portions of heap memory remotely without user interaction. The attack complexity is low, and the attacker requires low privileges to exploit the vulnerability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20661 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is impacted by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20661, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability without any user interaction, affecting various Windows Server and Windows client versions. The attack vector is network-based, and the vulnerability is remotely exploitable. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through a series of security updates for affected Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the availability of the impacted components. For more information and specific update details, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide linked in the source section of this post.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20660 Microsoft Message Queuing Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by an Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20660, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read small portions of heap memory, leading to information disclosure. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The vulnerability is remotely exploitable, impacting confidentiality but not integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2012. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20658 Microsoft Virtual Hard Disk Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Virtual Hard Disk is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20658, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, posing a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, addressing the vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The vulnerability's exploitability assessment indicates that no exploit code is available, and the remediation level is an official fix. This vulnerability underscores the importance of timely patch management to ensure the security of Microsoft Virtual Hard Disk installations.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20657 Windows Group Policy Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Group Policy Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2024-20657) has been identified with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and successful exploitation requires the attacker to win a race condition. The attack complexity is high, and no user interaction is required for exploitation. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of elevation of privilege attacks. For further details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20654 Microsoft ODBC Driver Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft ODBC Driver is affected by a Remote Code Execution Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20654, with a CVSS score of 8.0/7.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application by tricking an authenticated user into connecting to a malicious SQL server via ODBC. Successful exploitation requires low privileges and user interaction. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of remote code execution. For more information on the impacted products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20653 Microsoft Common Log File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Common Log File System is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20653, with a CVSS score of 7.8/6.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and it has a low attack complexity, requiring low privileges and no user interaction. This vulnerability impacts various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2012. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution in the form of security updates for the affected platforms. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20652 Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Security Feature Bypass vulnerability, CVE-2024-20652, has been identified in Windows HTML Platforms. The vulnerability has a CVSS base score of 7.5 and affects various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the MapURLToZone method, potentially leading to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Successful exploitation does not require user interaction and can impact resources managed by the same security authority. Microsoft has provided security updates for the affected platforms, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and various versions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attack complexity is high, and the attacker requires low privileges to exploit the vulnerability. No exploit code is currently available, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating that a complete vendor solution is available. For more information and specific build numbers for the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2022-35737 MITRE: CVE-2022-35737 SQLite allows an array-bounds overflow
section_1_data.summary: CVE-2022-35737 is a critical remote code execution vulnerability in SQLite, affecting various Microsoft products including Windows 10, Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, and CBL Mariner. The vulnerability allows for array-bounds overflow, enabling an attacker to execute arbitrary code. Microsoft has addressed this by including an updated library in Windows and releasing security updates for the affected products. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The severity of this vulnerability is rated as important, and it has not been publicly exploited at the time of original publication. The assigning CNA for this CVE is MITRE Corporation on behalf of the SQLite organization. For further details and specific build numbers for the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page for CVE-2022-35737.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability in SQLite allows an array-bounds overflow, which could potentially lead to remote code execution.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability involves updating the SQLite library in the affected Windows and Windows Server versions. Microsoft has released security updates for the affected products.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21337 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21337, with a base score of 5.2 and a temporal score of 4.5. The vulnerability allows a local attacker to gain elevated privileges, requiring user interaction and high attack complexity. Successful exploitation could lead to a browser sandbox escape, with potential minor impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has released a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.133 to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the official fix to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page.
section_1_data.symptoms: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability requires a user to take some action before the vulnerability can be exploited.
section_1_data.fixes: Currently, the vulnerability is unpatched. Users are advised to monitor Microsoft's official communications for updates about the availability of a patch or workaround.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20709 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20709 Javascript Implementation PDF Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a low severity Javascript Implementation PDF vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20709, assigned by Adobe Systems Incorporated. This vulnerability is caused by a flaw in Adobe Software consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.133. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2336.0 is no longer vulnerable. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page. The exploitability assessment indicates that exploitation is less likely. Microsoft has acknowledged the security community's efforts in coordinated vulnerability disclosure.
section_1_data.symptoms: A vulnerability exists in the Javascript implementation of Adobe Software consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based).
section_1_data.fixes: The fix is implemented in the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) which is no longer vulnerable to this issue. Users are advised to update to the latest version.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20675 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a Security Feature Bypass vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20675, with a CVSS score of 6.3/5.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the protection in Edge that prevents a potentially dangerous extension from being downloaded or updated. Successful exploitation requires a user to click on a specially crafted URL or install, limiting its impact. The vulnerability is rated as Low severity due to the level of user interaction required. Microsoft has released a security update (build number 120.0.2210.133) to address this issue. System administrators are advised to apply the update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0333 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by CVE-2024-0333, an Insufficient data validation vulnerability in Extensions. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.133 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.133. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) page.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) could allow an attacker to exploit insufficient data validation in Extensions.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is to update to the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) which is no longer vulnerable. The version is 120.0.2336.0.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20666 BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The post provides updated FAQ information for the BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20666. This is an informational change only, indicating no substantive updates beyond the previous revision. System administrators are advised to review the updated FAQ for any additional technical details or links for further research.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20658 Microsoft Virtual Hard Disk Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Virtual Hard Disk is impacted by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20658 with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, potentially leading to a complete loss of integrity and availability. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, addressing the elevation of privilege vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The availability of an official fix reduces the urgency of remediation, and no specific workaround or mitigation is mentioned. The post is an informational change only, providing updated FAQ information without substantive changes beyond the previous revision.
